preqs: (One of FIT1040 or FIT1002) and FIT2001

rules.ruleString: (Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {FIT1002, FIT1040} AND  Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {FIT2001} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS})
(Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {GCO2813, GCO2816, GCO9806} and  Incompatible with course version in {1794, 2146, 3301, 3803} with course status in {ENROLLED, INACTIVE, INTERMIT})

description: This unit examines object-oriented systems modelling/design in greater depth than the prerequisite unit. The key disciplines of the Unified Process will be examined to set a context for analysis and design. Students will learn about static and dynamic modelling, and component-based design, using UML. Some common design patterns will be studied. Some topics about software architecture are examined.The unit prepares students to be able to design large systems such as will be implemented in their final year project unit or after graduation.
